channel.title: Genre Challenge for April?
channel.description:
The [MARCH HOUSE CHALLENGE](https://disco.auxy.co/t/the-house-music-challenge-march-2018/8078/135) is halfway through and we've already had a few track submissions, with more House genres still to be completed.
It's been a fun experience already, with people trying out house genre's they may not be familiar with and I've been really impressed with the Auxy track submissions so far. Some forum members have already put their names down for more than one House genre. At the end of March, we'll collate a list of all the House music produced by this forum for everyone to check out. I'm looking forward to hearing the rest of the tracks as they're submitted. If you haven't been part of this, it's not too late to make a MARCH HOUSE TRACK, just check out the link above.
Now...
What genre should we tackle in April? Any suggestions?

item.title: Genre Challenge for April?
item.dc:creator: BobTheGUYYYYY
item.description:
I think it would be awesome to do a dubstep challenge with crazy techno noises and stuff

Read full topic

item.title: Genre Challenge for April?
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
Not all of the House genres were claimed, with some people preferring to double up on their preferred genre - which is fine, but shows that longer lists can lead to wasted genres.

Read full topic

item.title: Genre Challenge for April?
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
True, very true. I’d say that breakbeat is sufficiently large enough for the task by itself without the additional hip-hop genres.

I was more worried it wasn’t as large as the House challenge xD

Read full topic

item.title: Genre Challenge for April?
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
TheRealJFalc:

it might be more appropriate to link the two genres together as they are heavily related.

The problem is that the range of music gets too large - and that defeats the purpose of the challenge, which is to explore the sub-genre’s. I may take the opposite approach and go narrow instead ie: choose one specific sub-genre from the list and do it for a shorter period, like a week. That also removes the need to debate genres.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Genre Challenge for April?
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
The one thing is that hip hop and breakbeat are highly tied in with eachother as genres.

From the music map website,

Although Breakbeat is a genre defined by its technical rhythm component (see more below), there is an underlying racial aspect at stake. Just like Rock ‘n’ Roll is a white translation of black Rhythm ‘n’ Blues, so is Breakbeat the “Caucasian” version of black Rap music. Though this division is not as strong as the R&R / R&B polarity (many black artists are involved in making Breakbeat), it is remarkable how the overwhelming majority of Rap artists are black, while the overwhelming majority of Breakbeat artists are white (considering the fact that these two super-genres are so closely related to each other). This has spurred the necessity of a true “black Dance music genre”, leading to Jungle.

I think that, considering this, it might be more appropriate to link the two genres together as they are heavily related.

Read full topic

item.title: Genre Challenge for April?
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
Nice one JFalc. You’ve obviously spent some time on this. Thank you, because I needed some help.

Let’s see if anyone has any feedback on your lists.

People have different interpretations of genres sometimes, but keen to agree on a list that’s at least not obviously wrong, so thanks for the post.

Read full topic

item.title: Genre Challenge for April?
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
@MisterMaster I’ve been doing some more research along with this and I think possibly combining elements of Hip-hop and Breakbeat, as they can be similar genres at times, would make for a much more diverse challenge overall and can help introduce some more interesting things into the mix as a whole. I for one would love to try some MCing of sorts even if it’ll be totally cringe and awful.

spoiler

The complete list would potentially be:

Under the breakbeat genre:

  • 2-Step Garage (UK Garage, derivative of Nu Soul)
  • Acid Breaks
  • Ambient Breaks / Illbient (This one could possibly be split into two)
  • Anthem Breaks (Ties heavily into Trance)
    * Baltimore Club / Baltimore Breaks will outline this one below
  • Big Beat
    * Booty Bounce This is more hip-hop and it seems to be a bit of a misnomer for “Dirty South Rap” and/or Booty House
  • Breakbeat Hardcore
    * Breakpop This one feels like it should exist but I can’t find any information and it seems to be a bit of a misnomer or extremely fringe.
  • Breakstep / Breakbeat Garage
  • Breaktrance (Ties heavily into the decline of trance music)
  • Brokenbeat
  • Chemical Breaks
  • Dark Breaks
    * Doomstep can’t really find much info on this one and it also seems to be more jungle influenced
  • Dub Breaks
  • Electro Funk/Electro
  • EDM Trap/Trapstep
  • Florida Breaks
    * Funktronica This is a genre that, after doing some research, seems to be only manned by one notable artist. It also seems to be much more funk than breakbeat
  • Future Garage/Future Bass
    * Glitchstep Glitchstep is more jungle-derivative than breakbeat derivative.
  • Glitch Hop / Wonky
    * Jersy Club / Brick City Club will outline this one below
    * Krankstep I cannot find any information on this genre, and I believe it to be a misnomer of Crunk, which is a hip-hop genre
    * Modern Funk Modern breakbeat is actually a derivative of ye old funk. I don’t think the parent genre is explicitly breakbeat however.
  • Nu Electro
  • Nu Funk
  • Nu Skool Breaks
  • Nu Soul
    * Philly Club Will outline this one below
  • Psybreaks
  • Progressive Breaks
    * Synth Breaks I believe this one is a variation of progressive breaks
    * Synthpoppers This one seems to be a music artist
  • Trip Hop

In relation to the Club genres, they all do in fact exist and I have found an article to describe their differences. However I don’t know if they should be identified by a different title to help users understand it more, as they are all similar in some way. Perhaps Breakbeat Club - Baltimore, Philly and Jersy would be more useful? That’s just my thought.

In addition to this, I’ve separated out potential hip-hop genres into this list below:

  • Abstract Hip-Hop [hip-hop]
  • Bounce [Hip-hop]
  • “Classical” Hip-hop (Just plain hip-hop)
  • Crunk [Hip-hop]
  • Freestyle (Aka Electro Freestyle)
  • Ghetto Funk [Hip-hop]
  • Hip-hop Trap / Drill
  • LoFi Hip Hop
  • Miami Bass
  • New Jack Swing [Hip-hop]
  • Progressive Hip-hop
  • Rap and all its derivatives (Gangsta, East coast, West Coast, Dirty South)
  • Turntablism

I think with the diversity of this genre and the inclusion of the highly similar hip-hop genre will definitely make this an interesting challenge.

That was a good amount of research xD I’ll also be asking Kerfuffle as our local genre extraordinare expert for some assistance as well on this.

Read full topic

item.title: Genre Challenge for April?
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Some of them are similar and some of them seem to be heavy influences that tie elements together but might not be directly associated with breakbeat. Jungle evolved from breakbeat and Jamaican music. DnB evolved from Jungle. I’d say your list from earlier helps fill in more fringe genres as the website doesn’t have that many House genres either.

I will look into it more, I think some combining of the two and other aspects would be useful.

Read full topic

The Breakbeat genre’s listed on the MusicMap website are:
